headline: CTO and Co-Founder at Bot M.D. (YC S18)
summary:
Bot MD is an AI clinical assistant for doctors. Our chat based platform will reduce the amount of time and friction for doctors to look up medical information. We are currently hiring native Android engineers and Python+Django backend engineers!

Before I put on my startup hat, I was a research scientist working in the field of natural language processing and machine learning. I am interested in building machine learning applications to discover knowledge and "stories" from texts of all domains.

Interests: computational linguistics, natural language processing, text mining, information extraction, social media analysis.

I am always interested in the ML and NLP problems that others are solving so feel free to reach out!

experiences.title: Co-Founder / CTO
experiences.description: Bot MD is an AI clinical assistant for doctors. Our chat based platform will reduce the amount of time and friction for doctors to look up medical information. We are currently based at Block 71; come say hi!

experiences.title: Technical Advisor
experiences.description: At Intelllex, I support and advise the engineering team on building and designing scalable solutions to machine learning and natural language processing for their core products.

experiences.title: Technical Advisor
experiences.description:
At Stravito, I support and advise the engineering team on how to build and design machine learning and natural language processing into their core search product. Some of the projects that I advise on include:
- Improving the performance of a vanilla Elasticsearch search engines significantly through NLP (e.g., query expansion and parsing, intent understanding, keyword extraction, etc) and ML (e.g., learning to rank, boosting factor tuning, reranking, semantic embeddings, etc)
- Implement smart AI features such as document tagging and metadata extraction (i.e., time, place, names, brand information, etc).

experiences.title: Research Scientist
experiences.description:
I work in the Baidu-I²R Research Centre, which is part of I2R's Natural Language Processing department.
My current projects involve on sentiment analysis, topic tracking, and fine-grained automatic negation detection in Chinese user generated content.

experiences.title: Research Officer
experiences.description: We built an entity resolution system by leveraging unsupervised topical features. I designed a robust module for acronym identification, creatively using data from a large corpus of acronyms, and carefully crafting features to build a high precision acronym classifier. Our team’s system were ranked top 3 in the TAC 2010 Knowledge Population (KBP) task.

experiences.title: Technical Advisor
experiences.description: I worked on various ML and NLP related problems – automatic key phrase extraction, topical analysis, and author-expert ranking algorithms, etc. At AirPR, we deal with large datasets of billions of documents and we use Spark and AWS EMR to efficiently process the documents. I compliment the engineering team by providing expertise on ML/NLP as well as designing the architecture of large scale ML pipelines.

experiences.title: Graduate Research Assistant
experiences.description: I work with Noah Smith in the Noah's ARK NLP lab. My research interests are natural language processing and building statistical models for applications in text mining and knowledge discovery. I seek to build automated tools to help human efforts in analysis of text in politics, social media and scientific publishing. My previous coursework include NLP, probabilistic graphical models, advanced optimization, statistical machine learning & deep learning, analysis of social media.

experiences.title: Teaching Assistant for Natural Language Processing
experiences.description: Teaching assistant for 11-411/611: Natural Language Processing, an introductory class to natural language processing for senior undergraduates.

experiences.title: Visiting PhD Student
experiences.description: PhD student in-residence at University of Washington.

experiences.title: PhD Research Intern
experiences.description: I worked with Google Knowledge team to improve state of the art NLP pipeline. We proposed and implemented a novel model for performing joint inference on entity type tagging and coreference resolution, developing efficient algorithms to find good solutions in the high dimension combinatorics space using dual decomposition.

accomplishment_honors_awards.description: Prestigious fellowship covers up to 8 years of tuition and living expenses at top institutions in USA and UK.

accomplishment_courses.name: Structured Prediction for Language and Other Discrete Data

accomplishment_projects.title: yc-utils
accomplishment_projects.description: This is an assortment of utilities / functions that I have written and found useful for data manipulation and NLP. It is written mostly in C++, along with a mismash of scripts, libraries, modules, headers, etc written i n Python and Java

accomplishment_projects.title: Morphological Analyzer for Japanese Nouns, Verbs and Adjectives
accomplishment_projects.description: This is an open source morphological analyzer for Japanese nouns, verbs and adjectives that I built for the NLP lab class at CMU. The system builds upon the morphological analyzing capabilities of MeCab to incorporate finer details of classification such as politeness, tense, mood, voice attributes, and more. It is implemented in the form of a finite state transducer using the open source finite state compiler FOMA toolkit.

accomplishment_projects.title: ark-sage
accomplishment_projects.description: Ark-SAGE is a Java library that implements the L1-regularized version of Sparse Additive GenerativE models of Text (Einsenstein et al, 2011). SAGE is an algorithm for learning sparse representations of text.
